text: First, let’s design analysis.R script, called job SLURM array. change quite bit depending specific analyses, example look like. start defining constants: things across analysises (note: don’t really need set variables, think makes code cleaner easier maintain, charge like ). Note analysis_id n_cores variables, catch array task ID number CPUs SLURM environment. used select many analyses run, many resources can used run . define values SLURM job script . Now, let’s organise analyses grid analysis specifications (.e. combinations hemispheres, outcomes, models, datasets etc). row grid correspond single analysis. example want analyse hemispheres (lh rh), three different outcomes (thickness, area w_g.pct), two model specifications: one including interaction sex age (*), one without interaction (+). gives us total 12 analyses (2 hemispheres x 3 outcomes x 2 models). base R function expand.grid() useful way create grid possible parameter combinations, can also create manually prefer (example, certain combinations make sense ). use analysis_id variable select one specific parameter combination (.e. row grid) use define current analysis. example, : . take value hemisphere (just making sure character string factor); b. format outcome variable name correctly (adding vw_ prefix); c. define model formula current analysis (e.g. without interaction term). Finally, let’s run analysis “current” parameters:
code: # Load verywise library(verywise)  # Define project paths and constants ----------------------------------------------  proj_dir <- "path/to/main/project/directory"  fs_home <- "/path/to/FREESURFER_HOME" subj_dir <- "path/to/freesurfer/data"  outp_dir <- file.path(proj_dir, "results")  pheno_filepath <- file.path(proj_dir, 'phenotype_clean.rds')  # this part of the formula will be constant across all analyses covariates <- 'birth_weight + SES + ethnicity'  random_effects <- '(1 | id)'  # Get SLURM parameters ------------------------------------------------------------  analysis_id <- as.integer(Sys.getenv('SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID', unset = 1)) n_cores <- as.integer(Sys.getenv('SLURM_CPUS_PER_TASK', unset = 1)) # Define parameter space ==========================================================  hemis <- c('lh','rh') outcs <- c('thickness', 'area', 'w_g.pct') model <- c('*', '+')  param_grid <- expand.grid('hemi'=hemis, 'outc'=outcs, 'mode'=model)  # Select and process current parameter combination --------------------------------  params <- param_grid[analysis_id, ]  hemi <- as.character(params$hemi)  outc <- paste0('vw_', params$outc)  model_spec <- as.formula(paste(outc, '~ age', params$mode, 'sex +', covariates, '+', random_effects)) # Run analysis --------------------------------------------------------------------  output <- run_vw_lmm(formula = model_spec,                      subj_dir = subj_dir,                      outp_dir = outp_dir,                      hemi = hemi,                      pheno = pheno_filepath,                       n_cores = n_cores,                      FS_HOME = fs_home,                      save_ss = TRUE)
